comments:
I am trying to extract data from my report using the
IDataExtractionTask. I am working with Eclipse 2.1.1 nightly build.

Where
designReport is a working IReportRunnable instance
and _reportEngine is an intialized, running BIRT Report Engine.

**
   IRunTask task = _reportEngine.createRunTask(designReport);
   task.setParameterValues(parameters.getParameterValues());
    
   // run the report and destroy the egine
   task.run("C:/temp/temp.rptDocument");        
   task.close();
    
   IReportDocument rptDoc = _reportEngine.openReportDocument(reportPath);
   return rptDoc;
**

This runs fine.  I am able to view the report in the web viewer and as a
ByteArray. 

I pass the above 'rptDoc'
synchronized public IDataExtractionTask getDataExtractionTask(IReportDocument documentReport) throws Exception
 {
    if(documentReport == null)
       throw new Exception("documentReport is not available for Data extraction");             
    //Create Data Extraction Task
    IDataExtractionTask iDataExtractionTask _reportEngine.createDataExtractionTask(documentReport);

      return iDataExtractionTask;
 }

When calling createDataExtractionTask(documentReport) I get a NullPointerException.  Please see the below stack trace.

A dialog about this issue is also available on the eclipse.birt newsgroup under the thread "createDataExtractionTask Causing NullPointerException"

Created an attachment (id=51032)
rptDocument file that reproduces the issue
I'm assuming Sheldon is working with 3.1.1, not 2.1.1.
I am using Eclipse 3.2.0, the Eclipse version that ships with the BIRT 2.1.1 SDK.
Data should first fix the NPE problem.

I guess that you didn't put the parameter value for the report parameter used in property binding, so when do evaluatePropertyBindingExpr, we may get this report parameter's value is Null,which might cause NPE. Now I fix this NPE.
